00062 // An allocator compatible with the STL
00063 // This allocator uses the default map_file.
00064 // We don't actually include a reference to the shared file here, since that
00065 // would get stored in persistent memory.
00066 template<class T>
00067 class allocator
00068 {
00069 private:
00070     map_file * map_instance_;
00071 public:
00072     // Construct from another allocator
00073     template<class O>
00074     allocator(const allocator<O>&) :map_instance_(NULL)
00075     {
00076         map_instance_ = map_file::instance();
00077     }
00078 
00079     allocator():map_instance_(NULL)
00080     {
00081         map_instance_ = map_file::instance();
00082     }
00083 
00084     allocator(const map_file* instance):map_instance_(instance) {}
00085 
00086 
00087     typedef T value_type;
00088     typedef const T *const_pointer;
00089     typedef T *pointer;
00090     typedef const T &const_reference;
00091     typedef T &reference;
00092     typedef long difference_type;
00093     typedef size_t size_type;
00094 
00095     pointer allocate(size_type n)
00096     {
00097         if (!map_instance_) throw std::bad_alloc();
00098         pointer p = static_cast<pointer>(map_instance_->malloc(n * sizeof(T)));
00099         if (!p) throw std::bad_alloc();
00100 
00101         return p;
00102     }
00103 
00104     void deallocate(pointer p, size_type count)
00105     {
00106         map_instance_->free(p, count * sizeof(T));
00107     }
00108 
00109     void construct(pointer p, const_reference v)
00110     {
00111         new(p) T(v);
00112     }
00113 
00114     void destroy(pointer p)
00115     {
00116         p->~T();
00117     }
00118 
00119     template<class Other>
00120     struct rebind
00121     {
00122         typedef izenelib::am::allocator<Other> other;
00123     };
00124 
00125     bool operator==(const allocator<T> &) const
00126     {
00127         return true;
00128     }
00129 };

00132 // map_data
00133 // A type-safe wrapper around the root object of a map_file
00134 // It also constructs a new object when the file is empty
00135 template<class T>
00136 class map_data : public map_file
00137 {
00138 public:
00139     map_data(const char *filename,int uid=0,int flags = auto_grow|lock_cs, size_t init_size=0)
00140             :map_file(filename, uid, flags, init_size)
00141     {
00142         if (empty())
00143         {
00144             new(*this) T();
00145         }
00146     }
00147 
00148     T &operator*()
00149     {
00150         return *static_cast<T*>(root());
00151     }
00152 
00153     T *operator->()
00154     {
00155         return static_cast<T*>(root());
00156     }
00157 };
